content: needle 12 stitches when knitting the heel flap you have to join the stitches of the second and third knitting needles to one knitting needle cuff cast on 48 sts divide into 24 sts on circular needles join to work in the round being careful not to twist place marker to mark beg of round optional rnds 1-17 until cuff measures 2 in/ 5 cm work in 1x1 ribbed alt k1 p1 leg round 1 work in stockinette stitch all knit sts round 2 k3 p to end repeat rnds 1-2 for pattern until leg measures 2 1/ in/ 6 5 cm approximately 12 rnds 2 preparatory round k24 first circular needle k23 second circular needle move the last stitch of the round purl st of the previous round to the first circular needle 25 sts on first circular needle and 23 sts on second circular needle turn work heel flap the heel flap is worked back and front across the second 23 sts as follows row 1 wsr sl 1 p-wise p22 turn row 2 rsr sl 1 p-wise k22 turn row 3-19 until heel flap measures 2 in/ 5 cm repeat row 1-2 heel in the right side row 9 heel sts gusset resume working in the round pick up and knit 10 sts along the side of the heel flap next 25 sts work in leg pattern across the front of your sock start with purl st p k3 6 times p place marker optional pick up and knit 10 sts along the side of the heel flap 54 sts needles knit across the heel sts then k down the first set of new sts you picked up on the left side you ve reached the end of the round and all your sts have now been picked up *note from here on out you will only be knitting the leg pattern across the first 25 sts which makes up the top of your sock the sole of your sock the last 23 sts will be knit in stockinette decreases gusset round 1 work in leg pattern across 25 sts sl marker k1 ssk k around to 3 sts before the end of round k2tog k1 round 2 work without decreases sts repeat these two rnds until you have 48 sts on your needles *note if you have an odd number of sts
